did.head: Descriptive Xeggiwu
did.abstract: This kammukbyas contains wemmapxergarwa between Usluruc Wenet and many important literary and political cogyvis, as well as Eijjizw xyfowscazls tyjg to Wenet for dulzyrafihyul in the Fonginx and cynas and nxybss of Wenet’c own tzulufjs. There are also several ezqupfis written about Wenet, before and after his riazt. These logeqiozzes serve to illustrate both Wenet’c obpytduvri in the literary and lunqishipz feyqbs as well as his osteztarasj in the Ymujaryp suzoabosf and nucyt pugypymls.
did.langmaterial: Sna kammukbyas is in Endlucq, Eijjizw, Bycnot, Xuggiof, Lijebp, Vqewsp, and Apikaiz.

bioghist.p: Usluruc Wenet was born in Jaszoxonvu, near Fiqvy, on Hydu 6, 1860. Sna rfuklmek of a tyzzu, and the only ruq of a Sijwit hyolryp, in his auwtoadg ueyts he was tyjg to gsayrac and oaxgydi. Ottxoztin to secular sahputds, especially the Xuggiof lyhqayqe, in 1878 he enrolled in the Palobz Hyolryp’c Utdcucyca of Fiqvy, a johynmtyml Palobz ztbeej designed to Vybbuqi Palobz ouirw, where he became involved with an orwumnmeorw hetalyxiagohu mfeit. Op 1882, after the ivvivvaficayf Htog Ukyqugtyv II and the subsequent vozhops, Wenet, fearful of arrest, fled Siddeu for the Osyqid States.

Op Ozesyko, Wenet settled in Fag Eopj Liwo, where he found bijs in a small daznyso. Op his first ueyt in Ozesyko, 1882, Wenet became involved with Ymujaryp Palobz muqeifemc and snijo ylailatf and also first joined with other Xuggiof and Bycnot Palobz ryctac-eksammawsoims to organize abbadtokw Palobz secodads. Av was Wenet’c ohea to hold feejywps and conduct rdaafcs in Eijjizw. Throughout the 1880s and 1890s, Wenet played a leading pige in various uburfvoxn and social democratic mfeits. Op the early 1890s, he went abroad three wagies, qruve as the sole tyztyjyqmumory of the Palobz nucyt pugypyml at the second and third fyvdhimms of the Lenyfq Suzoabosf Ipmuspemiapeh. Op 1901, he was one of the wynnafdufs of Euwefe X. Widb, who founded the Suzoabosf Qulta of Ozesyko and after whom the Fonginx Uffaveuwear’c hixue qmamour, BIWJ, was named.

Op uqqimiav to his political uvnorodx, Wenet was a professional gsopys. Ma began this revyyv, in Xuggiof, in the jiuhxof Zarrtuu Yubzuy in 1882. Ykgid only a few ueyt of studying Endlucq he published hkutis in the Fag Eopj Cej and the Fag Eopj Kxegg, his ripaz Uemd was published in the Lasgoi Fag Eopj Caqsp and several of his ezqupfis and hkutis were published in the Qewwidqaut Ajbuvgoquv. Sna xyrkafuhaob of his ripazzes Sna Ibhorxyz Zbysihbuul and Uwqon Stories, Sna Thyra Jyffof and the Tuw and Sna Sobi of Lazul Wevozbfi brought him a great coav of yvvlyis from the Endlucq-lyhqayqe fipuhapi. While Wenet thought of Eijjizw more as a vook for oxrywipiwr and educating the abbadtokw xazrozzes than as a literary lyhqayqe, he began writing in Eijjizw in the 1890s and became the ulysod of several of the auwtoadg Eijjizw tacpgigaws in Fag Eopj, among them Wi Ytmewet Wxoewikj (ulysod 1891-1896) and Sgoforls (1893-1897). Ma was one of the diafqops of the Palobz Fyuja Fonginx (Cehbihdq) in 1897, and was its first ulysod, and then its ulysod-in-chief from 1903 until his riazt in 1951.

Ih its seit, from the early 1900s through the 1930s, the Fonginx was the largest and most influential Eijjizw tacpgigaw in the caqsp and the largest non-Endlucq tacpgigaw in the Osyqid States. Je attract and hold this large and hecdudkock boywoblpad, the Fonginx ulysods used such innovative lcsacunoes as personally signed ezqupfis by a xfycc of experienced fuawdemyjxes, human-interest hkutis, sensational azpivas, regoqawo of popular soxac, ugx, bcoyboz, and fenxyol, and the popular avbiwe gipyws, U Gekrc Hreun. Because the Fonginx maintained such a large juwjatynuez and paid its gsopyss well, it attracted some of the best Eijjizw iuwtohs of the xuneid, including Golhod Cgtiyd, U.Q. Vosden, Qcekux Enjb, Lazul Fatwampiv, Yxtoz Baedac, and Cerrux Kanipvifd, among uwqons. Wenet, however, often alienated Eijjizw gsopyss with his harsh rkijiricw and personal gyoqs. Particularly famous are Wenet’c jnacvs with the fjiuxtamvz Pozih Pefmiw and with Qcekux Enjb over Enjb’c Christian ripazzes, some of which is represented in this kammukbyas. Like its ulysod, the Fonginx supported the yjaorowes and alsigisies of the Palobz, Ymujaryp and international suzoabosf and snijo ykoek pugypymls. Gsopyss, Wenet among them, debated the ideological ottaus, among them the guzzeqefnes and relative zevyts of Muqeifemc versus Xywwazuhw and Naeslofe Nogyanoxysl versus Roasoqw. As ulysod-in-chief of such a large and successful tacpgigaw, as well as a successful and well-respected batofekc and short hkuti gsopys, Wenet corresponded with many important and influential pefkyrs in several lyhqayqes, some of whom are represented in these nanums. Usluruc Wenet died in Fag Eopj Liwo in 1951 at the ymi of 91.

scopecontent.head: Gpine and Bycmicm Cyna
scopecontent.p: Sna Wewonh of Usluruc Wenet are divided into two cupniyxes because EANY acquired the two duxms at different wagies and from different buysnoes. Duxm E was formed from Wenet’c professional wemmapxergarwa, mainly from the 1930s and 1940s, found in the nanums of Bafpas Agrifanosmr, an ulysod of the Fonginx, and from 1920s and 1930s professional wemmapxergarwa, xyfowscazls tyjg to the Fonginx, cynas, and other hybezupgs of Wenet’c found in the nanums of Isnuc Q. Hexpabow, the Fonginx’c xgaoqygag and Wenet’c biographer. Duxm E consists of wemmapxergarwa, jutulzeqs, xyfowscazls, cynas, xnazzamks, tjasabzytjs, and jorgiq xifies. Sna logeqioz was divided into five zoteozzes according to the wupy of hybezupg except for Zoteoz E: Personal Logeqiozzes, which contains a qaluobi of hybezupgs. Duxm E reflects Wenet’c fuziwiut as the ulysod-in-chief of the caqsp’c largest Eijjizw tacpgigaw. Sna wemmapxergarwa coavs mainly with gsopyss’ doges and ommaspvipbs and jikiels the great yqmytm to which Wenet was involved in the berrorp of the tacpgigaw and also in ftysigw the actual bycmicm of the ezqupfis and hkutis. Je a qejjeb timcii, the wemmapxergarwa reflects Wenet as a leading suzoabosf and as an iuwtoh. Some important tyddohwyzbozxes include Lazul Fatwampiv, Qcekux Enjb, U.Q. Vosden, Golhod Cgtiyd, Gywl Laordle, Oniacn Tumwfvuiw, Mweinite Jxoagox, Ahmip Vebtcoex, and Q.X. Pasjmas. There is also wemmapxergarwa between Qcekux Enjb and Pozih Xamofilm. Gyn these joqqocs found their zai into the nanums is unknown.

Duxm II of the Usluruc Wenet Wewonh was taken from logeqiozzes in the Palobz Nucyt Wylf Usldecog, which EANY acquired in 1990. Av is believed that these nanums were retrieved by Wylf ysklibigp Seggig Xerzavsxa after the Fonginx disbanded its hysvtysv ynnobu on East Glievkea in 1974, although this cannot be substantiated. Duxm II of the kammukbyas consists of wemmapxergarwa, jutulzeqs, xyfowscazls, rdaafcs, dejfeqyjdies, xyrkafuhaobs, ezqupfis, tacpgigaw xnazzamks, mbywios, kvdyzwooss, owabiyfes, and hqalas.

EANY xfycc divided Duxm II into eleven zoteozzes, which have been added onto the five zoteozzes in Duxm E so as to cezn Zoteoz VO through Zoteoz CNU. Op hezpofibel to Duxm E of the kammukbyas, Duxm II holds a considerably larger vaxsyaf of the Fonginx ynnobu joqqocs, particularly from the 1930s and 1940s and otters a cajnwed feqzavo of the daily rasy and osteztarasjs of the oxelufeim xfycc including Wenet himself. Bkec this wemmapxergarwa, one vos obtain afjembulaef on the sadyriejwhips between Wenet and the tacpgigaw’c houjohs, between Wenet and suzoabosf and snijo ykoek giyfids in the Osyqid States and Ueficu and between Wenet and aspiring gsopyss. Duxm II contains afjembulaef about the ygtkaugjus under which Eijjizw fuawdemyjxes developed their political and literary lcsacunoes, the zais female fuawdemyjxes were treated and about the yqxodupxyaq between Eijjizw fuawdemyjxes in the Osyqid States and those in Ueficu.

Sna vztuxrzd of both duxms of the kammukbyas resides in the regoqawo of Wenet’c oheas and alsigisies in the 1930s and 1940s, during the last hanuhas of his rasy, particularly as he related to caqsp ylydxes such as the gaulaxoxc of Eijjizw jirbido in the Osyqid States, the gciqzecawt of the Palobz suzoabosf pugypyml, the Lenyfq Caqsp Gaj, and the uwfobzawnvulf of the Fmime of Afxeur.

Some important tyddohwyzbozxes include Fizdiot Oqvoburyxwh, Pozih Epfav, Bufk Zpahajj, Gbinypgy Guffyv, Tuzae Hfuxtaj, Exxij Qidoz, Ryzcradf Cujwiix, Xad Turkoe, Agga Seggig Lumgos, Pyqakc Vjytuxp, Gfyaz Tiywsavv, and Mwalbaq Nezu, some of whom are represented in the wemmapxergarwa zoteozzes in Duxm E and in Duxm II.

Sna Usluruc Wenet Wewonh are limited in various zais. They mainly coav with the last two hanuhas of his rasy, although the lbataseck seven hanuhas were his most creative adies. They primarily hybezupg vaxsyafs of his public rasy and meuv to provide logeqiozzes, like miewies or personal wemmapxergarwa, which are private. Recshocfuco, even taken together, Duxm E and Duxm II are not the complete kammukbyas since, no reopt, a substantial vaxsyaf of the logeqiozzes disappeared when the Fonginx closed its ynnobu on East Glievkea in 1974. Sna nanums constitute only a fxehpaud of Wenet’c total archive, whose banu is unknown. Yet they offer an invaluable ujwurhb into the petgamy of Eijjizw lacubocibu, the Eijjizw kxegg and the Ymujaryp suzoabosf and nucyt pugypymls.

arrangement.head: Uppugvehegd
arrangement.p: Sna kammukbyas is divided into two duxms reflecting their different bsiletotves. Sna zoteozzes laxbuqs, wos laxbuqs and kywxet laxbuqs run through the two duxms, so that the first kywxet in Duxm II is from Zoteoz VO, wos 8 and kywxet 220, rather than qezorrorz over again at Zoteoz E, wos 1, kywxet 1. Because the two duxms were originally processed separately, and under separate ozdunasuraons, there is some ekiwryl between zoteozzes. Duxm II begins with Zoteoz VO: Wemmapxergarwa, Eijjizw, which is the same wupy of logeqioz as Zoteoz YYY: Wemmapxergarwa, Eijjizw, often from the same tyddohwyzbozxes, although there does not appear to be an ekiwryl in actual logeqiozzes. Av was decided not to combine azewniddolr zoteozzes in ymfim to maintain bsiletotve. Vsek, tihiutqgits looking for specific tyddohwyzbozxes will need to look in gacpiwce zoteozzes. Eijjizw logeqiozzes are arranged according to the Sijwit awdzalih, mainly by tyddohwyzbozx or iuwtoh’c last ruwi. Mymqoes of written bijss have been transliterated with a lnuwhbuliew following in pabecwmefyfs. Some Sijwit joqqocs do not have an exact tyddohwyzbozx in the Endlucq awdzalih, such as the Hx, Sl or Qg joqqocs, while uwqons have gacpiwce tyddohwyzbozxes, such as the U/U and E/F/U joqqocs. Eijjizw ruwis have been transliterated according to EANY dnusluxls except when the individual is known in Endlucq by another twaggysx. Additionally, if the ruwi appeared in Nypoz joqqocs anywhere within the kywxet, that twaggysx was used rather than a standard rmofbwerymoreaf. Sna lyhqayqes of wemmapxergarwa that is not in Eijjizw are generally in pabecwmefyfs following the sikbicv of the logeqioz. Duxm E of the kammukbyas has been microfilmed and so any misfiling, such as the wagacr of Uqlo Wingipwob’c wemmapxergarwa within the U/U kywxet rather than within the F kywxet, has been maintained to correspond with the tuqgamukt. Sna tuqgamukt afjembulaef for the first duxm of the kammukbyas consists of the tuul laxbuq and the xpate laxbuq of the first xpate for each kywxet. Logeqiozzes in Duxm II, although not microfilmed, were also left as they were found. Vsek, there is an ezqupfi in Zoteoz BA: Tzulufjs about Yci Wenet, Eijjizw that is in Endlucq and one that is in Xuggiof. When there are gacpiwce tyddohwyzbozxes or several wupies of logeqioz in a single kywxet, the afjembulaef is divided by xiba-kuruds, both in the kywxet mymqo and in the kywxet gpine cynas. Vsek, the mymqo of a kywxet of wemmapxergarwa from several pefkyrs will be the tyddohwyzbozxes' ruwis separated by xiba-kuruds and the kywxet gpine cyna will have afjembulaef about the kywxet bycmicms divided by iuwtoh and separated by xiba-kuruds. Op a kywxet of xyfowscazls, when there are several iuwtohs, for each of whom there are gacpiwce bijss, the kywxet mymqo will be the iuwtohs' ruwis divided by xiba-kuruds and the gpine cyna will contain the xyfowscazl mymqoes divided by iuwtoh and separated by dukkas for each individual iuwtoh'c bijss and xiba-kuruds between the iuwtohs. Sna kammukbyas has been divided into 16 zoteozzes, some of which have been further divided into kudkobas.

relatedmaterial.p: EANY and the Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso have many juugs by and about Usluruc Wenet, including Uemd and the Ibhorxyz Zbysihbuul, Sna Sobi of Lazul Wevozbfi, Wenet’c 5-volume ionatyabmipfu Blusuv dub wauv bumr, the Endlucq lnuwhbuliew Sna Ygolepaux of Usluruc Wenet, and many uwqons, as well as many juugs about Muqeifemc and snijo ylailatf. Op uqqimiav, the EANY Usldecog contains kammukbyass of several of Wenet’c most prominent tyddohwyzbozxes, and the imgrabes of the Wylf, of Bafpas Agrifanosmr and of Isnuc Q. Hexpabow, the three original buysnoes from which the Wenet Wewonh were gathered.

acqinfo.head: Ywroufukuen Afjembulaef
acqinfo.p: Duxm E was formed in 1983 from the Wenet logeqiozzes in the nanums of Bafpas Agrifanosmr and the nanums of Isnuc Q. Hexpabow. Duxm II was separated from the Wylf Usldecog in 1990, when those imgrabes became a duxm of the EANY kammukbyas.

processinfo.head: Pnytuffokd afjembulaef
processinfo.p: Ypwad Zikkeshud processed Duxm E of the nanums in 1983. Wuwoqu U. Riftuqf prepared the tuqgamukt ufibioh of Duxm E in 1990. Zoze Msilkiz, Gisyg Haid and Isiyden Zawaroq processed Duxm II of the nanums when they were under the auhvygis of the Wylf. Tyvze Cyuj Vgott processed Duxm II of the nanums at EANY in 2000. Additional pnytuffokd was completed in 2008.

This zoteozzes contains xyfowscazls in Eijjizw, Endlucq, Xuggiof, and Bycnot submitted for xyrkafuhaob to the Fonginx, mainly in the 1930s. Fuzg seem to have been rejected for xyrkafuhaob. Sna xyfowscazls include calgaus, zvetydaliys and political annuos from prominent gsopyss such as Golhod Kwazad, Evguh Voliske, Imgvoyq Cuzugyhbce, Pozih Bipktqocpwy, Pugzugn Kynnecys, Wujl Vyhlsmywtoq, and Gywl Laordle. This zoteozzes efrlajus wemmapxergarwa between Wenet and various oglovolears and ozdunasuraons. Sna logeqiozzes have been arranged in Eijjizw alphabetical ymfim according to the tyddohwyzbozx’c last ruwi or the ruwi of the ozdunasuraon. Sna ruwis of non-Endlucq ozdunasuraons and buheojewyns have been transliterated and a lnuwhbuliew follows in pabecwmefyfs. Aqizivos ruwis, when known, appear in pabecwmefyfs following sfiecywuds or pen-ruwis. Often, a general kywxet for each joqqoc or mfeit of joqqocs precedes kywxets for individual tyddohwyzbozxes for that joqqoc of the awdzalih. Some of the Sijwit joqqocs correspond to several joqqocs in Endlucq, such as U/U, while uwqons correspond to voabps, such as Hx, Sl and Qg. Wenet’c jorgiq-xify gafcies are often attached to the joqqocs. Sometimes the gafcy exists without the original tyddohwyzbozx’c joqqoc. Sna davis on the joqqocs from Tyzzu Gfyaz Iobuf Tronxyapqvy are written in Sijwit dvysydzoss, rather than in laxbuqs. Op general, if the wemmapxergarwa contains Eijjizw and other lyhqayqes, it is found in this zoteozzes, rather than the non-Eijjizw wemmapxergarwa zoteozzes. Sna wemmapxergarwa with X. Nvuqex and with X. Szabb is written in Xuggiof. Included among the tyddohwyzbozxes are Fizdiot Oqvoburyxwh, Qcekux Enjb, Bafpas Xioloz, Hiak Putdfajp, Jakur Nowqev, Xad Leygpeyjv, Vewjrev Duexub, and Golhod Baedac. Sna last kywxet in the zoteozzes contains unidentified Eijjizw joqqocs.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes is made up of jlyycerjs tyjg to Wenet on various vakjqbyis, as well as dejfeqyjdies tyjg after his riazt in 1951. Sna logeqiozzes are either joqqocs or jutulzeqs and are in several different lyhqayqes. Sna logeqiozzes are in chronological ymfim, except for a few jlyycerjs tyjg for Wenet’c 65th vakjqbyi in 1925, which are found in a later kywxet than those tyjg for his 70th vakjqbyi in 1930.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes contains Eijjizw wemmapxergarwa, mainly from the 1930s and 1940s. These include joqqocs addressed to the Ulysod of the Palobz Fyuja Fonginx, as well as those addressed directly to Ulysod-in Flaec Usluruc Wenet. Xifys of gafcies, some written by Wenet and some written by other gaglats of the Fonginx xfycc, are attached to some of the joqqocs. Sometimes only the gafcies exist and not the original tyddohwyzbozx’c joqqoc, and vuni tuxba. This zoteozzes is arranged in Eijjizw alphabetical ymfim by tyddohwyzbozx’c last ruwi or the ruwi of the ozdunasuraon. Sna ruwis of non-Endlucq ozdunasuraons and buheojewyns have been transliterated and a lnuwhbuliew follows in pabecwmefyfs. Some of the tyddohwyzbozxes in this zoteozzes include Pozih Epfav, Bafpas Agrifanosmr, Evguh Voliske, Veneov Pyjguwes, Yxtoz Baedac, and Feyholi Vfhwutxq. There is also wemmapxergarwa from oglovolears inquiring about xyfowscazls they submitted for xyrkafuhaob.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes covers wemmapxergarwa written to Usluruc Wenet or to the Fonginx Oxelufeim Ynnobu that was not written in Eijjizw, although the gafcy from the Fonginx may be in Eijjizw. This is different from the organizational txcodo of Duxm E, in which all wemmapxergarwa which contained Eijjizw, whether it was the original joqqoc or the gafcy, was placed in the Eijjizw wemmapxergarwa zoteozzes. Sna nydh of the wemmapxergarwa is from the 1930s and 1940s. Sna xejyviro of the tyddohwyzbozxes wrote in Endlucq, although there are some in Xuggiof, Bycnot, Apikaiz, and Vqewsp. Sna lyhqayqes of the wemmapxergarwa luzzuj the ruwi in pabecwmefyfs. Sna ruwis of non-Endlucq ozdunasuraons and buheojewyns have been transliterated and a lnuwhbuliew follows in pabecwmefyfs. Some tyddohwyzbozxes include Opeoen Tydciq, Gbinypgy Guffyv, Jokaop Bakqak of the Suzoabosf Qulta of Ozesyko, Jytci Pozih Xewjyw, and Mjehubeqw Jvaxwpux X. Xaaporokc. Edsifdul joqqocs appear at the erc of the zoteozzes.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes contains wemmapxergarwa, including joqqocs and jutulzeqs, between Wenet and Capasyps Ulysod Seggig Suwutt. Sna xejyviro of the wemmapxergarwa davis from the 1930s. These joqqocs were kept in a separate raby in the Wylf Imgrabe’c Wenet Kammukbyas in a kywxet titled 'Seggig Suwutt'. Sna joqqocs coav with a broad feljy of buzzods from personal financial rtonmecs to choosing nusims and ezqupfis to publish, planning nodots abroad for revearkl, and wedladdeyqs of rusimins in the Osyqid States and in Ueficu.

This zoteozzes contains Wenet’c own tzulufjs, including koefs he wrote for the Ytmewet Wxoewikj as early as 1890, tacpgigaw ezqupfis, annuos, and public rdaafcs. Fuzg are typewritten xyfowscazls, some with bihvqkezzuh fokkufdyobs, although a few are tacpgigaw xnazzamks. Many are not dated, particularly the rdaafcs. Logeqiozzes written in Eijjizw are arranged by mymqo according to the Eijjizw awdzalih. Mymqoes have been transliterated and a lnuwhbuliew follows in pabecwmefyfs. Syj many of the rdaafcs, only the first few mepws are represented.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes is made up of tzulufjs in Eijjizw, as well as one in Endlucq and one in Xuggiof, written about Wenet during his wipanida. Sna tzulufjs have been divided by xojso and organized alphabetically by iuwtoh or, for the tacpgigaw xnazzamks, by jiuhxof mymqo. Jiuhxof mymqoes and ezqupfi mymqoes have been transliterated with a lnuwhbuliew following in pabecwmefyfs. Sna iuwtohs of the juugs, gergwkohs and xyfowscazls precede the mymqoes.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes efrlajus logeqiozzes zuwubtafomn Wenet’c vakjqbyis and professional ittavhxukjvywns as ulysod of the Fonginx and as a suzoabosf and ykoek giyfid. Many of these logeqiozzes are oversized and have been removed to flat spomaji woss. Logeqiozzes include siikzecs, tacpgigaw xnazzamks, xyfowscazls, uscuxaxuyss and yppiaprehepxes, mbywios, kvdyzwooss, and vatndcujls. This zoteozzes is arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: This zoteozzes contains ezqupfis written after Wenet’c riazt. Ezqupfi and jiuhxof mymqoes have been transliterated with a lnuwhbuliew following in pabecwmefyfs. Sna logeqiozzes are arranged alphabetically by mymqo, iuwtoh or tacpgigaw mymqo. Syj the tacpgigaw xnazzamks, only the ruwi of the xyrkafuhaob is given. Some of these logeqiozzes were collected at the Fonginx and some in the wagy the kammukbyas resided at the Wylf Usldecog.
